title: Corrections & Amplifications
description: Corrections & Amplifications for the edition of April 22-23, 2023.

title: Biden's Second-Term Mistake
description: Age is only one of the reasons the President shouldn’t run again.

title: Randi Weingarten's Privilege
description: The teacher’s union chief reveals her double standard on locating charter schools.

title: Upside Down Mortgage Policy
description: A new federal housing rule will make reliable borrowers subsidize risky loans.

title: The CFPB's Great Data Heist
description: Chopra won’t disclose who stole personal data, and who was victimized.

title: AT&T, Netflix, BuzzFeed: Stocks That Defined the Week
description: Here are seven major companies whose stocks moved on the week’s news.

title: Why My New Novel About Racial Conflict Ran Into Trouble
description: Today’s identity politics has led many in the publishing industry to insist that writers can only tell stories about people like themselves. That’s bad for fiction and for our democracy.

title: Dominion v. Fox Shows Why Pressies Love Unnamed Sources
description: There’s much to be learned from new developments in the 2011 British phone-hacking scandal too.

title: Leave 'the American People' Alone
description: A smarmy plea for unity rings especially false at a time when the country is so deeply divided.

title: Move Over, Retirees: Millennials Are Coming for Your Cruises
description: As cruise lines navigate back to normal, they’re finding a surprising new wave of customers: millennial and Gen Z travelers. These younger passengers have their own reasons for thinking the boating life is cool. We sent a reporter on a cruise to Cozumel to discover what got them on board.

title: Taiwan's President Tsai Ing-wen Belongs at APEC
description: Biden would make a powerful statement by inviting her to the San Francisco summit.

title: The Pazzi Chapel: Heavenly Purity in Architecture
description: A masterpiece of Renaissance architecture long attributed to Brunelleschi may have been designed by someone else.

title: Latest Updates on Evan Gershkovich
description: Fans at an Arsenal vs. Southampton soccer game on Friday held up a banner in support of Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich, who was detained in Russia on March 29 on an allegation of espionage that the Journal and the U.S. government vehemently deny. Here are the latest developments and ways to express support.

title: 13 Books We Read This Week
description: Gerald Ford’s ambition, spies at war with Nazi Germany, the big book of Shakespeare, a tall tale of boxing and more.

title: FAA Acting Chief Billy Nolen to Depart
description: His decision comes as the air-safety regulator faces challenges, including a spate of near-collisions and technology problems.

title: Stocks Notch Weekly Losses as Investors Weigh Earnings Reports
description: Earnings season ramps up next week with Microsoft, Alphabet and Amazon on the docket.

title: Digital Signs Energize Old Fights Over Billboards
description: Debates over electronic signs around the world have now arrived in San Diego, which is considering allowing interactive kiosks on its streets.

title: The Salty Snack Your Guests Will Wrestle For
description: These crispy potato-prosciutto croquettes bring a little sizzle to any cocktail party. The simple recipe is a host’s secret weapon.

title: The Journal Acrostic: April 22
Twist Ties (Saturday Crossword, April 22)
Generative AI Cloud Startup CoreWeave Raises $221 Million Megaround
description: CoreWeave, a six-year-old startup that provides specialized cloud infrastructure for generative artificial intelligence, ChatGPT-like language models and other computing-heavy applications, has joined a group of technology startups bucking a monthslong slump in venture-capital investing.

title: See Photos of Rare Hybrid Solar Eclipse
description: Crowds gathered in western Australia, Indonesia and East Timor Thursday morning to witness a rare hybrid solar eclipse.

title: JPMorgan's Ties to Jeffrey Epstein Were Deeper Than the Bank Has Acknowledged
description: The bank has said it shut the convicted sex offender’s accounts in 2013, but its bankers were still meeting with him years later, people familiar with the matter said.

description: The property known as Lion House, which is newly renovated, is located in a luxury resort community on New Providence.

title: After SpaceX's Starship Explosion---Debris, Data and Analysis
description: Elon Musk’s company, along with regulatory and environmental agencies, is taking stock after the Starship rocket exploded a few minutes after lifting off in southern Texas.

title: Eurozone Economy Gathers Pace, PMIs Suggest

title: S&P Global Ratings' Review of Italy Expected Broadly Neutral for BTPs
description: S&P Global Ratings’ review of Italy later should be largely neutral for Italian government bonds, UniCredit Research said, expecting no change by the ratings firm.

title: Glynn's Take: Woe to Those Signing Up to the New RBA Board
description: Australian Treasurer Jim Chalmers moved to retool the country’s central bank this week by throwing out its old policy-setting board in favor of a modernized committee of experts that will look and operate a lot like similar bodies at the Bank of England and the Bank of Canada.

title: UK Retail Sales Drop as High Inflation Weighs
description: U.K. retail sales volumes dipped 0.9% in March, more than expected, and marked the first fall since December 2022, reflecting that cost-of-living pressures from high inflation are weighing on household spending.

title: Glencore Met Guidance, Backs Outlook
description: Glencore said its first-quarter production largely met expectations, with declines across copper, zinc, nickel, and coal, and retained its 2023 guidance.

title: EssilorLuxottica Boosted By Developing Regions
description: EssilorLuxottica reported a first-quarter revenue of €6.2 billion, beating consensus, supported by growth in Latin America and Asia Pacific regions.

title: Tele2 Backs Guidance
description: Tele2 reiterated its full-year and midterm targets after posting unchanged first-quarter underlying earnings as revenue growth and cost savings were offset by inflation pressures.

title: SAP Updates Guidance on Qualtrics Divestment
description: SAP revised its outlook for the year to account for the stake in Qualtrics International that it is divesting as the group continues to focus on its cloud business, the main driver of revenue growth in the first quarter.

title: Holcim Lifts Guidance After First Quarter Beat
description: Holcim raised its sales guidance for 2023, expecting growth of more than 6%, after reporting first quarter earnings that fell compared with last year but exceeded consensus expectations.

title: Credit Suisse Investors Challenge Switzerland's $17 Billion Bond Write-Down
description: Credit Suisse Group bondholders have launched a legal challenge in Switzerland against regulators’ decision to write down $17 billion in securities as part of UBS Group’s rescue of the troubled bank last month.

title: BHP Downgrades Escondida, Nickel Production Guidance

title: General Atlantic Exits Cancer-Care Investment
description: The firm is selling a majority stake in OneOncology to TPG and AmerisourceBergen in a deal that values the business at about $2.1 billion.

title: Pace of Japan's Consumer Inflation Slowed in March
description: Japan’s overall consumer prices rose at 3.2% from a year earlier in March, slightly slower than the 3.3% increase in February, government data showed.
